snippet: A 19-month investigation by a European intelligence agency found that nearly 700 games globally may have been fixed, with profits from the wide-ranging scandal totaling about $11 million.
abstract: European police agency Europol announces that its 19-month investigation of match-fixing in soccer has revealed 680 suspicious games in recent years; does not provide extensive detail, but notes that World Cup qualifiers and two Champions League games were included, leading to widespread speculation.

byline.contributor: David Jolly contributed reporting from The Hague.

lead_paragraph: A 19-month investigation by a European intelligence agency found that nearly 700 games globally may have been fixed, with profits from the wide-ranging scandal totaling about $11 million.

headline.seo: Europol Investigation Shows Fixing Is Suspected in 680 Soccer Matches
headline.main: Police Call Match-Fixing Widespread in Soccer
headline.print_headline: Police Call Match-Fixing Widespread in Soccer
